summary:
This Mod is a Dungeon/Player Home that requires you to have completed \'The Horn of Jurgen Windcaller\' quest and have the perk \'Steel Smithing\'
This Mod Is 90% Done
descriptionHtml:
[size=5][u][i][b]The Ancient Ruins Of Staadnau[/b][/i][/u][/size]

[size=4]Small Description[/size]
[size=2]This Mod is a Dungeon/Player Home that requires you to have completed \'The Horn of Jurgen Windcaller\' quest and have the perk \'Steel Smithing\'
This Mod Is 90% Done[/size]

[size=4]Location[/size]
[size=2]The dungeon \'Staadnau\' can be located south-west of \'Fort Greymoor\' on the road towards \'Rorikstead\'[/size]

[size=4]Why Is It Called Staadnau If Staadnau Means Unbound[/size]
[size=2]It is called Staadnau, due to the fact, that the dungeons master, is the Unbound King, and the fact that all undead are bound to its halls.[/size]

[size=4]Who Is The Unbound King[/size]
[size=2]The Unbound King was once a great and powerful warrior during the dragon war, however he believed himself to be a king, so he took all of his followers to his temple. Later a powerful mage entered his temple, and bound him and his followers to never leave, this caused their souls to never leave, and allowing them, although being dead, to roam the halls, forever.[/size]

[size=4]Reward[/size]
[size=2]The reward for defeating the Unbound King are; a new player home, a new spell, and two new weapons.[/size]

[size=4]Known Issues And How To Surpass Them[/size]
[size=2]If one has already completed the quest Horn of Jorgan Windcaller, before downloading the mod, they may not be able to enter the Dungeon.
To fix this, simply either type, \'help Staadnau\', into the console and type \'player.additem ########\' (the id to the Staadnau Key not the master key), or you could simply carry on the main quest, to the point where you see Alduin resurrecting the named dragon Sahloknir, there will be a burnt corpse with the key on their burnt corpse.[/size]

[size=3]I have also added a new lore book that you can buy from Urag at the College of Winterhold, or from any tavern in the Whiterun hold or even at any pawnbroker in th Whiterun hold.[/size]

[size=4]Credits[/size]
[size=2]Enoomnai for making the mod
AlduinV3 for supporting me
Usnex for teaching me how to use the Creation Kit and the Mod Editor
Bethesda for making the amazing games known as The Elder Scrolls
Todd Howard for being Todd Howard[/size]
author: Enoomnai
